00083 /*************************************************************************
00084  * Compiler- and platform-specific preprocessor work
00085  *************************************************************************/
00086 
00087 /* If we are we on Windows, we want a single define for it.
00088  */
00089 #if !defined(_WIN32) && (defined(__WIN32__) || defined(WIN32) || defined(__MINGW32__))
00090  #define _WIN32
00091 #endif /* _WIN32 */
00092 
00093 /* It is customary to use APIENTRY for OpenGL function pointer declarations on
00094  * all platforms.  Additionally, the Windows OpenGL header needs APIENTRY.
00095  */
00096 #ifndef APIENTRY
00097  #ifdef _WIN32
00098   #define APIENTRY __stdcall
00099  #else
00100   #define APIENTRY
00101  #endif
00102 #endif /* APIENTRY */
00103 
00104 /* Some Windows OpenGL headers need this.
00105  */
00106 #if !defined(WINGDIAPI) && defined(_WIN32)
00107  #define WINGDIAPI __declspec(dllimport)
00108  #define GLFW_WINGDIAPI_DEFINED
00109 #endif /* WINGDIAPI */
00110 
00111 /* Some Windows GLU headers need this.
00112  */
00113 #if !defined(CALLBACK) && defined(_WIN32)
00114  #define CALLBACK __stdcall
00115  #define GLFW_CALLBACK_DEFINED
00116 #endif /* CALLBACK */
00117 
00118 /* Include because most Windows GLU headers need wchar_t and
00119  * the OS X OpenGL header blocks the definition of ptrdiff_t by glext.h.
00120  * Include it unconditionally to avoid surprising side-effects.
00121  */
00122 #include <stddef.h>
00123 
00124 /* Include because it is needed by Vulkan and related functions.
00125  */
00126 #include <stdint.h>
00127 
00128 /* Include the chosen client API headers.
00129  */
00130 #if defined(__APPLE__)
00131  #if defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_GLCOREARB)
00132   #include <OpenGL/gl3.h>
00133   #if defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_GLEXT)
00134    #include <OpenGL/gl3ext.h>
00135   #endif
00136  #elif !defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_NONE)
00137   #if !defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_GLEXT)
00138    #define GL_GLEXT_LEGACY
00139   #endif
00140   #include <OpenGL/gl.h>
00141  #endif
00142  #if defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_GLU)
00143   #include <OpenGL/glu.h>
00144  #endif
00145 #else
00146  #if defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_GLCOREARB)
00147   #include <GL/glcorearb.h>
00148  #elif defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_ES1)
00149   #include <GLES/gl.h>
00150   #if defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_GLEXT)
00151    #include <GLES/glext.h>
00152   #endif
00153  #elif defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_ES2)
00154   #include <GLES2/gl2.h>
00155   #if defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_GLEXT)
00156    #include <GLES2/gl2ext.h>
00157   #endif
00158  #elif defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_ES3)
00159   #include <GLES3/gl3.h>
00160   #if defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_GLEXT)
00161    #include <GLES2/gl2ext.h>
00162   #endif
00163  #elif defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_ES31)
00164   #include <GLES3/gl31.h>
00165   #if defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_GLEXT)
00166    #include <GLES2/gl2ext.h>
00167   #endif
00168  #elif defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_VULKAN)
00169   #include <vulkan/vulkan.h>
00170  #elif !defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_NONE)
00171   #include <GL/gl.h>
00172   #if defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_GLEXT)
00173    #include <GL/glext.h>
00174   #endif
00175  #endif
00176  #if defined(GLFW_INCLUDE_GLU)
00177   #include <GL/glu.h>
00178  #endif
00179 #endif
00180 
00181 #if defined(GLFW_DLL) && defined(_GLFW_BUILD_DLL)
00182  /* GLFW_DLL must be defined by applications that are linking against the DLL
00183   * version of the GLFW library.  _GLFW_BUILD_DLL is defined by the GLFW
00184   * configuration header when compiling the DLL version of the library.
00185   */
00186  #error "You must not have both GLFW_DLL and _GLFW_BUILD_DLL defined"
00187 #endif
00188 
00189 /* GLFWAPI is used to declare public API functions for export
00190  * from the DLL / shared library / dynamic library.
00191  */
00192 #if defined(_WIN32) && defined(_GLFW_BUILD_DLL)
00193  /* We are building GLFW as a Win32 DLL */
00194  #define GLFWAPI __declspec(dllexport)
00195 #elif defined(_WIN32) && defined(GLFW_DLL)
00196  /* We are calling GLFW as a Win32 DLL */
00197  #define GLFWAPI __declspec(dllimport)
00198 #elif defined(__GNUC__) && defined(_GLFW_BUILD_DLL)
00199  /* We are building GLFW as a shared / dynamic library */
00200  #define GLFWAPI __attribute__((visibility("default")))
00201 #else
00202  /* We are building or calling GLFW as a static library */
00203  #define GLFWAPI
00204 #endif
00205
